Blog.post: Well I've decided that Monday will be the big day at work where I'll put my two weeks notice in. I'm so over working in the computer industry. Never again will I have a job where I sit in front of a computer screen and work in a cubicle all day. I'm taking the next three months off from working entirely and will start looking for a job sometime in September.

now that i'm unemployed its back to cheap eats. tonights dinner: start by opening a can of Pabst Blue Ribbon (now any recipie that starts like that is bound to be tasty). place two bratwusrt and some chopped onion in a pot and cover with Pabst. cook for 15, plate and serve with some spicy ass mustard. now i had mine with a side of sweet potato fries with ginger mayonaise too! this ain't fuckin' emeril live you hear? tommorow night its Top Ramen and Jiffy corn bread...stay tuned.

Today was my last full day of work. I came home and cranked up the AC as its hotter than hell here. Turned on the TV put a favorite movie in the VCR and settled in to take a break. Not five minutes into the movie a fuse blows. Every outlet in my apartment it tied to a single 15 amp fuse. AC kicked on and poof! I rummage around and find a penny fuse that fits and all is well. Except that now my VCR is having an epileptic seizure and no longer responding to command. I fucked with it for like 10 minutes before I got out the screwdriver. and of course they don't come apart easily and I was getting really pissed because the fucking thing had eaten one of my favorite animes (not available on DVD by the way). so what the screwdriver wouldn't remove the pliers and hammer did and I think I salvaged all but a few seconds of my movie. The VCR however did not survive. (Times when I wish I had a digital camera). I put all the parts back in it and screwed the case back on. looks fine from the outside! I ended up rigging up the TV just so I can watch cable on it and then the fucking remote isn't working for it. The worst thing is that I still have to go out and buy a new VCR. WTF!

Girls hugging each other, kissing, groping, arm wrestling, showing off tatoos, and all while playing urlLink Quizzo . And yeah, there were a few scary dyke lesbians but for the most part they were freaky and hot! Come on urlLink Suicide Girls ! 50 drunk-man-hating lesbos can be intimidating but oddly enticing. still, even under pressure I made the male race proud in Quizzo.

technical note: The Blogger.com backend is all coded in CSS which is new to me. Up until today the front-end was in HTML using tables and inline frames, not exactly the most scalable solution. So today I learned some basic CSS and recoded the entire site. I am pretty satisfied with the results, mainly that you shouldn't notice any changes in the layout and the inline frame is gone. There are still a few minor layout tweaks that need to be addressed and the code is not yet 100% CSS compliant but I'm working on it. drop me a line if you notice anything funky.

Bobo went and saw urlLink Cowboy Bebop: The Movie tonight at urlLink The Charles . There were only about ten people in the theatre and Bobo was the only one by himself. Then this pretty girl came in by herself at sat next to Bobo. Bobo really liked the movie, great story and classic Bebop dialogue. But the movie reminded Bobo a lot of his ex-girlfriend and the things they used to share. One scene in particular where Ein, the welsh corgie, walks around with a jack-o-lantern on his head while radical Edward dances and sings in the middle. By the end of the movie Bobo was sad and when the pretty girl tried to catch his attention he ignored her. And he went home and felt sorry for himself; sorry for what he had lost and he knew that he was a fool.

so i wake up in the middle of the night yesterday and saw this greenish glowing light in my bedroom. my first thought is that here comes the alien anal probe or something. then the light goes out and reappears a few seconds later on the other side of the room. a few seconds later it goes out again and reappears at the foot of the bed. now I'm usually pretty out of it when I first wake up and plus I was already halfway in the tank so the old cognitive neurons just weren't firing too well. I slapped my night stand light and start looking around for the aliens. damn thing lights up again on the wall and that's when I see it. It being a fucking lighting bug. well you can bet his greenish glowing ass is now permanently smeared all over one of my walls. The way I figure it is that he snuck in through window AC unit. other bugs have tried before but they just get ejected into my room as little bug bits after they run into the ACs fan. not sure how this one made it but it looks like it was a one way journey.

Beer #1 Winner My life is meaningless; when drinking beer in the setting of a taste becomes an enjoyable practice, end it all...soon; This beer is rather enjoyable however; sugary aroma; sweet taste with a slightly bitter after-taste, though not overwhelmingly either (sweet/bitter) Beer #2 Bobo's ass smell begins to join beer aroma as he has just decided to pass gas for the fourth time during this short taste test; Deep into my second beer I am curious as to why I got out of bed this morning? Opting rather to lay pondering existence like most pseudo intellectuals (I think that is what they do) Beer tastes of back-wash from the homeless man I was forced to avoid on my way to the house; bland and disgusting Beer #3 Aroma is of Vomit; but on the bright side..most of my friends have abandoned me; thinking me for un-intelligent, true - very true; decided to abandon my opinions in hopes of withering away into nothingness. Beer is unusually sweet with a sickening bitter after taste (I likened it to strychnine) which lasts up to and well into the next gulp, which makes stomach feel not-so-good; may see this one again later in the evening - in my own throat as I pass out gasping for breathe Beer #4 Aroma reminds one of why cheap beer is best left for closet case homosexual Jocks who enjoy vomiting on each other before a find evening of arousing varsity level ass fuck'n - not so good; not even worthy of some existential rant, albeit depressing Junior-College existentialism; Ahhh Sartre would be proud - whoops, back to reality; Beer is Horrid, reminds me of a story: 'What the fuck Dad, why not?' Josh, with a huff of air, horse breath 'Watch that language before I watch it for ya' Dad, close set eyes, Jack breath, or Jim 'Failure' Punch to the gut, Josh down hard Back up with swift movement Swallowed teeth, blood pool under foot Dad wallowing in son's mess Proud Jack breath' or was it Jim.

Last night we did a little "Cheap beer blind taste test" i figure now that I unemployed I'll need to find a less expensive beer to enjoy. so here are the results which were quite surprising I might add: Beer #1 -- No hop aroma, sweet and full-bodied, mild aftertaste, nice pin point carbonation, not immediately ready to vomit. verdict...tastes like another Beer #2 -- less hoppy than #1. No flavor whatsoever, didn't even taste like water. designed primarily for use in beer bongs and for shotgunning. Beer #3 -- First impressions were that it smelled like something that I had definitely vommited up before. It had nice head retention but a lot of off flavors, kinda left a metal spoon taste in your mouth. seem like it would be best suited for beer pong games at college parties. perhaps that's why it smelled familiar? Beer #4 -- worst smell ever! horrible bouquet. tasted a lot like beer #2. something funky going on in the flavor department but it did have a smooth finish and no off flavors. not too bad. my rankings and post taste test labels revealed: 1st place beer #1 -- Pabst Blue Ribbon second place beer #4 -- Carling Black Label third place beer #2 -- Strohs Original fourth place goes to beer #3 -- Shaeffer Tester's comments: subjects were cooperative and belching was complimentary. researcher indulged in snobby uppity import beer during test. Beer #4 procduced the best belch of the evening.

i've been feeling kinda on edge all day. lots of anxiety, shaky hands, not sure what the deal was. just felt a bit off. case of nerves i guess you could say. not even sure what would cause it. I currently don't really have any stress in my life; no job, no girlfriend, no responsibilities (except rent and food and I have that covered for the next few months), i'm being productive as an artist, i'm even sewing a shirt for myself. I figure now that I have so much free time I should learn to sew, but that is a whole new story and I'll fill you in later. today I learned more about nap, selvage, and basting. i have all these great fashion ideas and i figure that i should start making some shit myself . anyway, back to the nerves thing. not sure what was going on but I went over to a friends house to fix his fiance's computer which she had royally fucked up (through no fault of her own, just a bit of internet naivety). had a glass of port and the nerves diminished, followed by three beers and I felt, well, normal. not the best sign. came home and figured I have a shot (ok, well two) of Black Haus(i give up i can't find a decent fucking link for it, its a blackberry schnapps and pretty strong too) and hopefully be able to fall asleep tonight. did I mention i haven't been sleeping either. like i said, very odd. anyway, down the hatch and off to bed. rode my urlLink fixed gear bike to school for the first time today. quite an adventure. it's about a 4 mile ride and almost all downhill which ended up being scary as shit. riding a bike that can't coast and has only a front brake through rush hour traffic down massachusetts ave. is not the best idea. I was on the brake the whole time and could barely keep my legs going fast enough. the real shitty part was the climb home tonight. it would have been ok with clipless pedals but with regular pedals, jeans, and a pair of campers I could barely push over the 42X16 gear. think i need to find a flatter and less crowded route or at least a freewheel!

1-22-04 He looks like a skeleton Of himself At 67’ and never looked back Since.. Is it that it gets that bad Sometimes, that the death Creeps into even his life? I’m finding it within Mine more often than you’d Like to think. Sculpting suicide Notes out of my own ashes, scattered For the birds and the fishes to eat. Table scraps lying around like fat, Gristle, And even women, ready for the Feast, yet I’m still left hungry. I Too need weights to keep me bound To this heaven, keep me far from that hell, I too need affirmations to keep my eyes On fire, keep my emotions bottled Away in drunken, insane fits of rage. For You.....dear self (or 10-28-03) Twenty - one, and wishing I, as lonely and vulgar as a door nail, was as vague as Lowell. Thoughts of death and humorous deviations of Christ line my mental umbrella. yet somehow I still miss the importance. Lifeless lines of verse flow like the stanzas of a soldiers life, in a foxhole; on the eve of his desertion. All familiar yet too far gone to be exact. How much will does it take to forget sorrows and forget loneliness for the minute, unabashedly squalid detail that it is? Will bourbon do; make it a double? I still know not of what it takes to be great (or at least elusive, for chris-sakes.) But patterns of me are written, just for , perhaps, you.

1/6/04 or I am America As apple pie as: "1984" or Salinger when 13 and Dieing to escape the cold grip Of the suburbs. Or was that the warm Embrace? Sometimes forgotten over Long trips to the supermarket And vacations from the beat to Banana Republic. I know now That I am America. I am the great fear Of all rebellion and the Icy breath of wrinkled grandparents Named "pop-pop" with wrinkled Eyes and lost hair, murmuring "Spend wisely," as they hand you Their last buck. I am America. Skateboards and graffiti markers Were once my textbooks and art, Now all I have is Derrida and Sol LeWitt. I am America, and at 12 was an Anarchist, And am sorry (I should have been a Socialist after all….there really ought to Be some structure) I am America. As My millions go on, dead, dying, Rich, killing, soiled, forgotten, I am America because all I do is Complain.

4-21-04 or cantaloupe Like those that try and conceptualize the idea of life not the meaning like some reading books on language and related biblical texts referring to the vast public infrastructure that led to the ultimate demise of…you We all pitter and quail under the fluorescent lights of mothers asking “what can we do to help? how can it all go away and still not be gone” Screaming back in tongues of the biblical: “Leave me alone, alone, alone, alone, alone, alone…” repeated ad-infinite until the words begin to bend and mold, mildewed resin becomes decoration for the ages. Lessons learned. Diseases complicated; unknown utterances finally solved…the puzzle is somehow related to Adam, and the garden with god’s own tarnished voice harrowing over our lives like plague.

riding this fixed gear bike is going to blow out my knees. initial testing with the vintage Mr. Coffee has not gone well. safety was not a key issue for the designers of the 1970's machine and it gets extremely hot, in places that it should not. first pot of coffee resulted in a severely burned thumb. however, it makes nice hot coffee. the same cannot be said for the lukewarm shit that is passed of as coffee by $tarfucks and Au Bon Pain. today's coffee was a bit weak, but maybe the machine was simply calibrated for the stronger blends of coffee that were available in the 70's. conspiracy theory, i think so. everything was bigger and badder in the 70's. big bell bottoms, big hair, big muscle cars, and strong ass coffee. tomorrow I'll brew the beans double strength in my effort to reclaim Mr. Coffee Manifest Destiny. stay tuned for the continuation of this exciting saga.
